intro: Commiphora elliptica, commonly known as the African myrrh, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh trees. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and produces a resinous sap that has been used traditionally for medicinal and aromatic purposes. Its bark and leaves are often harvested for their aromatic compounds. Commiphora elliptica thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soils.
